intro: Oxytropis nigrescens var. lonchopoda, commonly known as the purple sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, pea-like pods that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of its native habitat.
